full_summary:
=====================================

### Title: The Canadian Alcohol and Drugs Survey (CADS)

### Reference and Solicitation Numbers #WS3734332706 and #Solicitation #WS3734332706

#### Latest Amendment: Amendment #3 (Decreased as of December 5, 2022)

The Canadian Alcohol and Drugs Survey (CADS) is a request for proposals that was posted on November 8, 2022. Bids are due on December 19, 2022 at 2:00 pm EST.

### Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has partnered with the Department of Health (HC) to deliver a national survey of Canada's alcohol and drug use. The contractor will be responsible for conducting a survey with a minimum of 36,000 participants aged 15 years and older who reside in Canada.

The expected contract duration is estimated to end on March 31, 2024, with optional two-year extension periods.

### Service Requirements

* Conduct a national survey of Canada's alcohol and drug use among a minimum of 36,000 15-year-old and above resident Canadians.
* Support the Department of Health (HC) in achieving the objectives and deliverables of the survey.

### Trade Agreements and Contracting Entity

This request for proposal is guided by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). The contracting entity is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC). The government agency managing this request is the Ministère des Travaux publics et des Services gouvernementaux (SPAC).

### Tender Information

* **Procurement Category:** SRV
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Request for Proposal Status:** Expiration Status
* **UpgradesIfExists:** Closed Exhibit

#### Instructions to Respond

To be considered, respondents must submit all required documentation and the bid by December 19, 2022 at 2:00 pm EST. Any documents or submissions received after this time will be considered non-responsive.
